New Records: Alek Thomas hit the first pinch-hit two-run homer in NLCS history
Key Match Events: Alek Thomas' pinch-hit two-run homer in the 8th inning tied the game, Gabriel Moreno's RBI single in the 8th inning gave the Diamondbacks the lead, Cristopher Sanchez hadn't started a game in 26 days, Kyle Schwarber's 19th postseason home run, a record for left-handed hitters
Pre-Game Insights: The Diamondbacks were considered underdogs, the Phillies were favored to win the series, the Diamondbacks' young core was expected to struggle in the NLCS
Post-Match Reflections: Torey Lovullo praised the Diamondbacks' young core, Alek Thomas expressed his trust in the coaching staff and his readiness to contribute, Gabriel Moreno praised the team's resilience and determination
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Chase Field with a crowd of 47,806, the Diamondbacks' bullpen game kept the score close, the Phillies' bullpen imploded in the 8th inning
Others: The series is now tied 2-2, the Diamondbacks will face the Phillies in Game 5 on Saturday night with Zack Wheeler and Zac Gallen on the mound
